rows.label: bf03290100_0010
rows.name:
Looks like those rumors about war with Superbia 
might finally be true.

rows.label: bf03290100_0020
rows.name:
They've been building up their military lately, 
and their fleet keeps growing.

rows.label: bf03290100_0030
rows.name: These ships look different to normal ships.

rows.label: bf03290100_0040
rows.name:
We use Divine Beasts as weapons 
without needless modifications.

rows.label: bf03290100_0050
rows.name: That's the Invidian way - keeping things natural.

rows.label: bf03290100_0060
rows.name: I've seen tons of Invidian ships at the trading company.

rows.label: bf03290100_0070
rows.name: Their approach is the complete opposite of Superbia's.

rows.label: bf03290100_0080
rows.name: That's exactly why they're bound to clash.

rows.label: bf03290100_0090
rows.name: They've never gotten along, not since way back.

rows.label: bf03290100_0100
rows.name:
From an outsider's view, Superbia looks worse. 
Plastering machines all over the place.

rows.label: bf03290100_0110
rows.name:
That's just how it looks to us - bet they don't even 
mind it themselves.

rows.label: bf03290100_0120
rows.name: What? Even with all those painful-looking modifications?

rows.label: bf03290100_0130
rows.name:
Divine Beasts and humans live 
together - that's just how it works.

rows.label: bf03290100_0140
rows.name: Hmmm...

rows.label: bf03290100_0150
rows.name:
Take me for example - had a hut on my back and 
a crane stuck in my behind.

rows.label: bf03290100_0160
rows.name:
Never complained once, even when he lit up a charcoal 
grill on me.

rows.label: bf03290100_0170
rows.name: You actually enjoyed the grill, didn't you?

rows.label: bf03290100_0180
rows.name: Mhm, that really did feel nice!

rows.label: bf03290100_0190
rows.name: In fact, I miss it...

rows.label: bf03290100_0200
rows.name: If I did that now, we'd end up with roast Divine Beast!

rows.label: bf03290100_0210
rows.name: You've got a point there.

rows.label: bf03290100_0220
rows.name: [ML:undisp ]Teeheehee!
